org.ingatan.component.text
Class SymbolMenu

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.ingatan.component.text.SymbolMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class SymbolMenu
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Provides a symbol menu which may be used as an inline menu for JTextComponents. Given a base letter, a list of special characters is shown. A character may be selected by using the left and right keys and pressing enter, or clicking one of the characters. The menu will hide itself if it loses focus. Scrolling may be added at a later date so that the menu can be narrower/resized and still usable.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getCharacterMap

public java.util.HashMap getCharacterMap()
Returns the character map used by this component. The character map is preset for this class and is generated in the constructor method.

getSpecialCharacters

public java.lang.String getSpecialCharacters(char baseCharacter)
Returns the array of special characters associated with a specified base character. For example, for base character 'a', 'àáâãäåæ' is returned. If there are no special characters associated with the specified base character, a String containing only that baseCharacter is returned. The base character will never otherwise be included in the returned String.

Parameters:
baseCharacter - the character upon which the returned string of special characters is based
Returns:
a string of special characters associated with the specified base character

setBaseCharacter

public void setBaseCharacter(char baseCharacter)
Sets the base character for this symbol menu so that it displays the corresponding special charactes. If no special characters are associated with the specified baseCharacter, the baseCharacter is set as an empty String, and if the SymbolMenu is rendered, it will show an empty menu.

Parameters:
baseCharacter - the base character to set the menu to.

charHasSpecialChars

public boolean charHasSpecialChars(char baseCharacter)
Check whether or not a particular character has special characters associated with it.

Parameters:
baseCharacter - the base character to check.
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not special characters are associated.

moveSelectionRight

public void moveSelectionRight()
Moves the current selection index 1 place to the right within the array of special characters. If the currentBaseCharacter is "", then the index will remain at zero. If the index is about to equal the length of the array, then it will be reset to index 0.

moveSelectionLeft

public void moveSelectionLeft()
Moves the current selection index 1 place to the left within the array of special characters. If the currentBaseCharacter is "", then the index will remain as zero. If the index is about to equal -1, then it will be set to arrayLength-1 (wrap around selection).

moveSelectionEnd

public void moveSelectionEnd()
Moves the current selection index to the end of the array, length-1. If the length of the array is 0 (that is, "") then the index is left as 0.

moveSelectionStart

public void moveSelectionStart()
Moves the current selection index to the beginning of the array, 0.

getCurrentIndex

public int getCurrentIndex()
Get the current selection index.

Returns:
the current selection index.

getCurrentBaseCharacter

public char getCurrentBaseCharacter()
Get the current base character.

Returns:
the current base character, or a question mark if there is none.

getSelectedCharacter

public char getSelectedCharacter()
Get the currently selected special character. If the base character is not valid, a question mark will be returned.

Returns:
the currently selected special character.

getCharacterAt

public char getCharacterAt(int index)
                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Get the character in the special character array at the index specified.

Parameters:
index - the index of the required character.
Returns:
the character at the specified index, or a question mark if no valid base character is set.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is not valid.

setCurrentIndex

public void setCurrentIndex(int index)
                     throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Set the current selection index.

Parameters:
index - the new selection index.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is not valid.

getCurrentCharCount

public int getCurrentCharCount()
Get the current number of special characters associated with the base character.

Returns:
the number of special characters associated with the base character.

getStringWidth

public int getStringWidth()
Gets the width of the string of special characters associated with the current base character as a dimension when painted in the graphics context of this component.

Returns:
The width of the string of special characters associated with the current base character.

setBorderColour

Parameters:

setBackgroundColour

Sets the colour used for the background of the menu.

Parameters:

setSelectFillColour

public void setSelectFillColour(java.awt.Color selectionFill)
Sets the colour used to highlight the current selection. This value should have at least partial transparency.

Parameters:
selectionFill - the colour used to highlight the current selection.
